conclusion: The system is in equilibrium, so the sum of forces in both horizontal and vertical directions must be zero.
Denote the tension in rope OP as T1, in rope OA as T2, and in rope OB as T3.
For object A, the forces are tension in rope OA (T2) and gravitational force (m_A * g).
The angle between rope OA and the vertical is 45 degrees.
Resolve the tension into horizontal and vertical components.
Vertical component must balance gravitational force, horizontal component must balance tension in rope OB.
For object B, the forces are tension in rope OB (T3) and gravitational force (m_B * g).
Rope OB is horizontal, so tension in rope OB must balance gravitational force.
For the system, tension in rope OP (T1) must balance sum of tensions in ropes OA and OB.
Calculate tension in rope OB (T3): T3 = m_B * g = 10 kg * 10 m/s^2 = 100 N.
Calculate tension in rope OA (T2): T2 * cos(45) = T3, T2 = 100 N / (sqrt(2)/2) = 141.4 N.
Calculate tension in rope OP (T1): T2 * sin(45) = m_A * g, T1 = 141.4 N / sqrt(2) = 100 N.
Final tensions are: T1 = 100 N, T2 = 141.4 N, T3 = 100 N.
